member.name: M:ExceptionExtensions.RethrowWithNoStackTraceLoss(System.Exception)
member.summary: Rethrows an exception object without losing the existing stack trace information
member.remarks: For more information on this technique, see http://www.dotnetjunkies.com/WebLog/chris.taylor/archive/2004/03/03/8353.aspx. The remote_stack_trace string is here to support Mono.

member.summary: Unwraps an exception to remove any wrappers, like .
member.returns: The unwrapped exception.

member.name: T:Xunit.IClassFixture`1
member.summary: Used to decorate xUnit.net test classes and collections to indicate a test which has per-test-class fixture data. An instance of the fixture data is initialized just before the first test in the class is run, and if it implements IDisposable, is disposed after the last test in the class is run. To gain access to the fixture data from inside the test, a constructor argument should be added to the test class which exactly matches the .
member.typeparam: The type of the fixture.

member.name: T:Xunit.Sdk.ExceptionAggregator
member.summary: Aggregates exceptions. Intended to run one or more code blocks, and collect the exceptions thrown by those code blocks.

member.summary: Adds an exception to the aggregator.

member.name: M:Xunit.Sdk.ExceptionAggregator.Run(System.Action)
member.summary: Runs the code, catching the exception that is thrown and adding it to the aggregate.

member.name: M:Xunit.Sdk.ExceptionAggregator.ToException
member.summary: Returns an exception that represents the exceptions thrown by the code passed to the method.
member.returns: Returns null if no exceptions were thrown; returns the exact exception is a single exception was thrown; returns if more than one exception was thrown.

member.name: T:Xunit.Sdk.LambdaTestCase
member.summary: A simple implementation of wherein the running of the test case can be represented by an . Useful for emitting test cases which later evaluate to error messages (since throwing error messages during discovery is often the wrong thing to do). See for a use of this test case to emit an error message when a theory method is found that has no test data associated with it.

member.name: T:Xunit.Sdk.XunitTestCase
member.summary: Default implementation of for xUnit v2 that supports tests decorated with both and .

member.summary: This class inherits from and reimplements in a way that allows the object to live longer than the remoting default lifetime (5 minutes).

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:Xunit.Sdk.InlineDataDiscoverer
member.summary: Implementation of used to discover the data provided by .

member.name: T:Xunit.Sdk.IDataDiscoverer
member.summary: This class is responsible for discovering the data available in an implementation of . The discovery process may not always have access to reflection (i.e., running in Resharper), so the discoverer must make a best effort to return data, but may return null when there is not enough information available (for example, if reflection is required to answer the question).

member.name: M:Xunit.Sdk.IDataDiscoverer.GetData(Xunit.Abstractions.IAttributeInfo,Xunit.Abstractions.IMethodInfo)
member.summary: Returns the data to be used to test the theory.
member.remarks: This will be called during discovery, at which point the may or may not be backed by reflection (i.e., implementing ). If the data is not available because reflection is required, then you may return null to inform xUnit that the quantity of data is unknown at this point. When the tests are run, if you returned back null during discovery, then this method will be called again to retrieve the data, this time guaranteed to provide an implementation of . At this time, you must return the actual data, and returning null is not legal.
member.param: The method that is being tested/discovered
member.returns: The theory data (or null during discovery, if not enough information is available to enumerate the data)

member.name: T:Xunit.PropertyDataAttribute
member.summary: Provides a data source for a data theory, with the data coming from a public static property on the test class. The property must return IEnumerable<object[]> with the test data.

member.name: T:Xunit.Sdk.DataAttribute
member.summary: Abstract attribute which represents a data source for a data theory. Data source providers derive from this attribute and implement GetData to return the data for the theory.

member.name: T:Xunit.Sdk.AttributeBase
member.summary: This class exists to have a base class for attributes that don't run afoul of the brain-dead caching algorithm in the CLR's attribute discovery system. Thanks, CLR team.

member.name: M:Xunit.Sdk.DataAttribute.GetData(System.Reflection.MethodInfo)
member.summary: Returns the data to be used to test the theory.
member.param: The method that is being tested
member.returns: One or more sets of theory data. Each invocation of the test method is represented by a single object array.

member.name: M:Xunit.PropertyDataAttribute.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of /
member.param: The name of the public static property on the test class that will provide the test data

member.name: P:Xunit.PropertyDataAttribute.PropertyName
member.summary: Gets the property name.

member.name: P:Xunit.PropertyDataAttribute.PropertyType
member.summary: Gets or sets the type to retrieve the property data from. If not set, then the property will be retrieved from the unit test class.

member.name: T:Xunit.Record
member.summary: Allows the user to record actions for a test.

member.name: M:Xunit.Record.Exception(System.Action)
member.summary: Records any exception which is thrown by the given code.
member.param: The code which may thrown an exception.
member.returns: Returns the exception that was thrown by the code; null, otherwise.

member.name: M:Xunit.Record.Exception(System.Func{System.Object})
member.summary: Records any exception which is thrown by the given code that has a return value. Generally used for testing property accessors.
member.param: The code which may thrown an exception.
member.returns: Returns the exception that was thrown by the code; null, otherwise.

member.name: T:Xunit.Sdk.BeforeAfterTestAttribute
member.summary: Base attribute which indicates a test method interception (allows code to be run before and after the test is run).

member.name: M:Xunit.Sdk.BeforeAfterTestAttribute.After(System.Reflection.MethodInfo)
member.summary: This method is called after the test method is executed.

member.name: M:Xunit.Sdk.BeforeAfterTestAttribute.Before(System.Reflection.MethodInfo)
member.summary: This method is called before the test method is executed.

member.name: T:Xunit.FactAttribute
member.summary: Attribute that is applied to a method to indicate that it is a fact that should be run by the test runner. It can also be extended to support a customized definition of a test method.

member.name: P:Xunit.FactAttribute.DisplayName
member.summary: Gets the name of the test to be used when the test is skipped. Defaults to null, which will cause the fully qualified test name to be used.

member.name: P:Xunit.FactAttribute.Skip
member.summary: Marks the test so that it will not be run, and gets or sets the skip reason

member.name: P:Xunit.FactAttribute.Timeout
member.summary: Marks the test as failing if it does not finish running within the given time period, in milliseconds; set to 0 or less to indicate the method has no timeout

member.summary: Provides a data source for a data theory, with the data coming from inline values.

member.name: T:Xunit.TheoryAttribute
member.summary: Marks a test method as being a data theory. Data theories are tests which are fed various bits of data from a data source, mapping to parameters on the test method. If the data source contains multiple rows, then the test method is executed multiple times (once with each data row). Data is provided by attributes which derive from (notably, and ).

member.summary: Attribute used to decorate a test method with arbitrary name/value pairs ("traits").
